plant.title: Chrysanthemums
plant.toxicity_level: âš ï¸ MODERATE TOXICITY â€“ GI & NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS
plant.summary: Chrysanthemums contain pyrethrins and sesquiterpene lactones that can cause vomiting, diarrhea, drooling, and even depression or incoordination in cats.
plant.what_to_do:
**Contact your vetâ€”even small ingestions matter.**

1. Remove plant access immediately.
2. Rinse mouth gently with water.
3. Call your veterinarian or **ASPCA APCC** at **(888) 426-4435**.
4. Monitor closely for 24 hoursâ€”neurological signs can develop.

> ğŸ’¡ Note: â€œMumsâ€ are common in fall arrangementsâ€”keep them out of reach during holidays!

plant.contentHtml: âš ï¸ Disclaimer: PawSafePlants provides general educational information only. This content is not veterinary advice. If your cat has been exposed to any plant, contact a licensed veterinarian or the ASPCA Animal Poison Control Center immediately. We do not guarantee the accuracy, completeness, or timeliness of this information. Use at your own risk.
